title.narrative: Sierra Leone (la): Aide ciblée aux pays
Sierra Leone: Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

Cette activité détaille notre travail sur le Aide ciblée aux pays en Sierra Leone (la), grâce à la mise à disposition des données budgétaires et des transactions. Nous fournissons également les documents pertinents qui guident ces activités que sont les formulaires de demande de soutien fournis par le gouvernement de Sierra Leone (la) ainsi que les lettres de décisions émises par Gavi, pour progresser. Ces documents décrivent les activités, les objectifs ainsi que les bénéficiaires.

This activity details our work on Targeted country assistance in Sierra Leone through the provision of budget and transaction data. We also provide the relevant documents that guide these activities, which are the support request proposal(s) provided by the Government of Sierra Leone, as well as the decision letter(s) issued by Gavi, for progress. These documents describe the activities, the objectives as well as the beneficiaries.

condition.narrative: Conditions are detailed in the Partners’ engagement framework
Conditions are detailed in the Partners’ engagement framework

title.narrative: Clinton Health Access Initiative : Health Information Systems (Data)

1. Management review and response system established in 4 new districts with relevant and timely monthly data being provided from and to PHUs to inform data and delivery improvements.
2. Mobile device for data entry needs assessment and feasibility study completed

target.value: Provide technical support on data strengthening activities with focus on increasing quality, accuracy, and completeness of information from all levels: 1) Targeted improvements to improve access to data for key performance indicators 2) Conduct and identify improvements in routine data analysis including support on the coordination of the NLTWG and quarterly M&E meeting 3) Implement management review and response system at 4 additional districts 4) Assess suitability and develop strategic plans for further integration with existing MoHS technology solutions

Provide technical support on data strengthening activities with focus on increasing quality, accuracy, and completeness of information from all levels: 1) Targeted improvements to improve access to data for key performance indicators 2) Conduct and identify improvements in routine data analysis including support on the coordination of the NLTWG and quarterly M&E meeting 3) Implement management review and response system at 4 additional districts 4) Assess suitability and develop strategic plans for further integration with existing MoHS technology solutions

title.narrative: 1. Implemented a routine system of supply data use in vaccine allocation planning and/or other target supply chain processes at central and district level. 2. Response systems supported to ensure that supply chain data is used to improve outcomes at district and PHU level.

target.value: Support program to make use of data on stock and wastages to identify necessary improvements in supply chain performance and key processes (e.g., vaccine stock allocation to districts and PHUs), reinforcing use of data for decision making

Support program to make use of data on stock and wastages to identify necessary improvements in supply chain performance and key processes (e.g., vaccine stock allocation to districts and PHUs), reinforcing use of data for decision making

title.narrative: Clinton Health Access Initiative : Data

1. Commence management review and response system implementation in 4 new districts with DMOs, DOOs, M&E and DIOs fully engaged.
2. In each of the 4 districts selected by the Parties, triangulation of the following data sets :immunization, antenatal visits, surveillance, RRIV / supply and regular monthly assessment of their completeness and data quality checks implemented quarterly and tracked over time.
3. Management review and response system implementation commenced in 4 new districts with DMOs, DOOs and DIOs fully engaged.
4. Tool, system and process improvements for data entry identified, documented, proposed and supported (HMIS, LMIS in selected 4 districts

target.value:
Implementation of "Data Review and Response System" and Capacity Building of EPI and district teams in phased manner in 4 new districts selected by the Government, including:
1. Support EPI, district teams/facility-in-charges/EPI focal persons in select districts for making use of Stock Ledgers/Stock Requisition and DHIS2 RRIV data for improvements in data reporting, quality, and vaccine stocks through monthly review and follow ups
2. Development of Data Quality Audit (DQA) Tools and perform Data Quality Audits (Quarterly) at sampled health facilities in select districts to improve the quality and reliability of data reported in DHIS2 (e-HMIS).
3. Capacity building/training of District Operations Officer (DOO) 1 & 2 from districts on DHIS2 Dashboard (HF2/RRIV) and Data Audits for Data Review and Response System
4. Targeted training on data reporting and improving data quality of EPI Focals (up to 50% of facilities in selected 4districts) who are deemed most in need of the training to improve reporting and quality
5. Support with the use of new facility-level open and closed vial wastage data (RRIV) to help forecast next years supply needs

title.narrative:
1. Management review and response system established in 4 new districts with relevant and timely monthly data being provided from and to PHUs to inform data and delivery improvements.
2. Mobile device for data entry needs assessment and feasibility study completed

target.value: Provide technical support on data strengthening activities with focus on increasing quality, accuracy, and completeness of information from all levels: 1) Targeted improvements to improve access to data for key performance indicators 2) Conduct and identify improvements in routine data analysis including support on the coordination of the NLTWG and quarterly M&E meeting 3) Implement management review and response system at 4 additional districts 4) Assess suitability and develop strategic plans for further integration with existing MoHS technology solutions

title.narrative:
1. Full utilization of the ?COVID-19 routine immunization tracker? by program to monitor RI trends at National and District-levels
2. Monthly PHU/Hospital-level analysis covering all health facilities across districts where RI services are offered under EPI. . of trends in routine immunization levels and reporting rates available in the tracker per antigen type.
3. Report submitted to the EPI and Gavi Programme with recommendations on which Districts and Health Facilities could be prioritized in future catch-up campaigns based on data analysis of COVID-19 impact on routine immunizations vs. historical trends, enabled by the use of the tracker.

target.value: Supporting "data for decision-making" in deciding which districts, chiefdoms and facilities are to be prioritized or de-prioritized for catch-up/intensification of RI activities based on impact tracking of COVID-19 using DHIS2 data. The use of tracker by EPI to continue until the administration of Covid19 vaccine is completed.

title.narrative: Clinton Health Access Initiative : Programme Management - General

1. Provide training and handover of ?the tracker? to EPI M&E Team by December 2020.
2. Support EPI to update ?the tracker? for continued use in 2021 (by February if required).

target.value: Support COVID response: 1) Technical assistance in development of tools to determine Covid19 impact on routine immunization activities 2) Technical support in spotting RI challenges till the level of PHUs posed by Covid19 pandemic 3) Support in development of Covid19 RI recovery plan 4) Support in national performance and progress review of the RI activities including Covid19 impact 5) Support in deployment and usage of technology solution for rapid assessment and dissemination of lessons learnt during catch up campaigns

Support COVID response: 1) Technical assistance in development of tools to determine Covid19 impact on routine immunization activities 2) Technical support in spotting RI challenges till the level of PHUs posed by Covid19 pandemic 3) Support in development of Covid19 RI recovery plan 4) Support in national performance and progress review of the RI activities including Covid19 impact 5) Support in deployment and usage of technology solution for rapid assessment and dissemination of lessons learnt during catch up campaigns

title.narrative: WHO : Data
70% Sentinel surveillance and case based data on VPDs generated and shared timely

target.value: Support sentinel surveillance for new vaccines (Rota, PBM, Influenza) and Measles as well as support conduct of quarterly program review meetings

title.narrative: 50% of districts trained on EPI app integrated into DHIS2

target.value: Training of district health teams on on utilization of the EPI app integrated with DHIS2 training : 4 participants per district

title.narrative: Survey protocol/concept note for conduct of cEPI review in 16 districts developed and localimplementing partner identified.

target.value: Conducting comprehensive EPI review

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Management - LMC
Established functional NITAG as measured by standard criteria

target.value: Support strengthening of the National Immunization Program management by a) Facilitating development of National Immunization operations Plan and review of cMYP through consultative workshops , b) Capacity building on Mid-level managers (MLM), c) supporting establishment of NITAG and functioning of ICC through orientation of members, facilitating biannual NITAG and ICC meetings and monitoring of recommendations; d) Facilitating indepth national immunization review meetings and tracking of action points,

Support strengthening of the National Immunization Program management by a) Facilitating development of National Immunization operations Plan and review of cMYP through consultative workshops , b) Capacity building on Mid-level managers (MLM), c) supporting establishment of NITAG and functioning of ICC through orientation of members, facilitating biannual NITAG and ICC meetings and monitoring of recommendations; d) Facilitating indepth national immunization review meetings and tracking of action points,

title.narrative: CDC : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
Program plan updated to reflected feedback from stakeholders

target.value: Technical support around planning of interventions to improve coverage/uptake/demand and address equity issues in low performing districts in Sierra Leone based on data generated from CDC's ongoing mixed-methods Urban Needs Assessment and GAVI/EPI KAP survey being planned together with UNICEF and partners

title.narrative: UNICEF : Vaccine-Specific Support
HPV introduced into all districts, evidenced in campaign report

target.value: Support planning implementation and monitoring of new vaccine introduction - support vaccine, cold chain management and logistics related to HPV introduction in routine immunization. Support proposal development for HepB birth dose introduction

title.narrative: Orders for HPV vaccine placed and cold chain rapid assessment conducted in preparation of the HPV introduction

target.value: Support the planning, implementation and monitoring of new vaccine introduction - including rapid assessment for cold chain readiness and effective supply management for the introduction of HPV.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Health Financing/Sustainability
Government endorsed multi-year transition plan for increased immunization financing

target.value: 1) Propose solutions to identified challenges at the budget development and execution stages for vaccine procurement; 2) Develop a multi-year forecast for vaccine procurement (incl. co-financing of EPI supplies); 3) Support the goverment in the development of a multi-year transition plan to gradually take over the funding for procurement of traditional vaccines; 4) High-level advocacy / development of the advocacy messages for increased domestic resources for EPI

1) Propose solutions to identified challenges at the budget development and execution stages for vaccine procurement; 2) Develop a multi-year forecast for vaccine procurement (incl. co-financing of EPI supplies); 3) Support the goverment in the development of a multi-year transition plan to gradually take over the funding for procurement of traditional vaccines; 4) High-level advocacy / development of the advocacy messages for increased domestic resources for EPI

1) Propose solutions to identified challenges at the budget development and execution stages for vaccine procurement; 2) Develop a multi-year forecast for vaccine procurement (incl. co-financing of EPI supplies); 3) Support the goverment in the development of a multi-year transition plan to gradually take over the funding for procurement of traditional vaccines; 4) High-level advocacy / development of the advocacy messages for increased domestic resources for EPI

title.narrative: A multi-year forecast for EPI financing with transition plan developed with government engagement

target.value: 1) Propose solutions to identified challenges at the budget development and execution stages for vaccine procurement; 2) Develop a multi-year forecast for vaccine procurement (incl. co-financing of EPI supplies); 3) Support the goverment in the development of a multi-year transition plan to gradually take over the funding for procurement of traditional vaccines; 4) High-level advocacy / development of the advocacy messages for increased domestic resources for EPI

title.narrative: WHO : Financial/General Management
NIS developed and endorsed by ICC by the end of Q4 2021.

target.value: Development of national immunization strategy to guide the program in the next five years

title.narrative: WHO : Vaccine-Specific Support
HPV PIE report with lessons learnt and recommendations

target.value: Conduct post HPV introduction evaluation
Conduct post HPV introduction evaluation
Conduct post HPV introduction evaluation

title.narrative: Post HPV introduction evaluation field work with data collation/validation completed in 16 Districts by the end of Q4 2021.

target.value: Post-HPV introduction evaluation particualy given the fact that national scale up is done in context of COVID-19

title.narrative: Attained >90% level of readiness for HPV introduction at national and district level

target.value: Support country to introduce HPV in 2021 through a) technical support to adapt guides, tools and monitoring readiness, b)Stakeholder sensitization workshop to creat awareness on multi-pronged approach towards cervical cancer, c) deployment of 1-2 national TAs for focused support to high priotiy districts

Support country to introduce HPV in 2020 through a) technical support to adapt guides, tools and monitoring readiness, b)Stakeholder sensitization workshop to creat awareness on multi-pronged approach towards cervical cancer, c) deployment of 1-2 national TAs for focused support to high priotiy districts

Support country to introduce HPV in 2020 through a) technical support to adapt guides, tools and monitoring readiness, b)Stakeholder sensitization workshop to creat awareness on multi-pronged approach towards cervical cancer, c) deployment of 1-2 national TAs for focused support to high priotiy districts

title.narrative: EPI Policy guide updated and disseminated

target.value: Updating of guidelines and policies, a) Immunisation in Practice (IIP) guideline, b) EPI policy guide review , finalisation and dissemination
Updating of guidelines and policies, a) Immunisation in Practice (IIP) guideline, b) EPI policy guide review , finalisation and dissemination
Updating of guidelines and policies, a) Immunisation in Practice (IIP) guideline, b) EPI policy guide review , finalisation and dissemination

title.narrative: Documentation of Measles laboratory processes and SOPs completed.

target.value: Assessment exercise on the Central Public Health Reference Laboratory for full accreditation for Measles laboratory investigations.

title.narrative: ODK-based digital supervisory checklist/v customized to accomodated 100% of CH/EPI identified priority issues.

target.value: Revision of supervision questionnaire and training on ODK

title.narrative: HPV guidelines and training materials developed

target.value: Support country to introduce HPV in 2021 through a) technical support to adapt guides, tools and monitoring readiness, b)Stakeholder sensitization workshop to creat awareness on multi-pronged approach towards cervical cancer, c) deployment of 1-2 national TAs for focused support to high priotiy districts

title.narrative: Phase 2 Covax, RI catch up activities and IPV vaccination implemented

target.value: Support the planning, implementation, supervision and monitoring of inttrroduction of new vaccines (nOPV2, Covax, IPV, HPV), including RI catch-up activities and Vaccine Preventable Disease Outbreak responses (OBR). To include conduct of readiness assessments as applicable, development and validation of training guidelines and data tools, support coordination and conduct of. trainings, independent monitoring and evaluation activities, etc.

title.narrative: cVDPV2 Outbreak Response and phase 1 Covax introduction done

target.value: Support the planning, implementation, supervision and monitoring of inttrroduction of new vaccines (nOPV2, Covax, IPV, HPV), including RI catch-up activities and Vaccine Preventable Disease Outbreak responses (OBR). To include conduct of readiness assessments as applicable, development and validation of training guidelines and data tools, support coordination and conduct of. trainings, independent monitoring and evaluation activities, etc.

title.narrative: UNICEF
1) IPC modules to improve communication between service providers and care takers. 2) Concept note for male involvement strategy developed

target.value: 1) Provide support to the implementation of an HPV communication plan with focus on strengthening inter-personal communication (IPC) of service providers. 2) Build a model for male involvement for promotion of EPI services by pilot testing the intervention in WAR

title.narrative: HPV introduced in all districts with not less than 80% coverage of target group (14 year age cohort)

target.value: Support planning implementation and monitoring of new vaccine introduction - support vaccine, cold chain management and logistics related to MR SIAs and introduction of MR and HPV in routine immunization.

title.narrative: 1) Report on mapping of vaccine procurement budgeting process available.

target.value: 1) Propose solutions to identified challenges at the budget development and execution stages for vaccine procurement; 2) Develop a multi-year forecast for vaccine procurement (incl. co-financing of EPI supplies); 3) Support the goverment in the development of a multi-year transition plan to gradually take over the funding for procurement of traditional vaccines; 4) High-level advocacy / development of the advocacy messages for increased domestic resources for EPI

title.narrative: 1. Vaccine orders informed by accurate vaccine quantification; 2. Report on cold chain assessment in preparation for HPV introduction

target.value: Support planning implementation and monitoring of new vaccine introduction - support vaccine, cold chain management and logistics related to HPV introduction in routine immunization. Support proposal development for HepB birth dose introduction

title.narrative: Geo mapping report available

target.value: In-depth analysis on cold chain optimization options for improved supply chain management (geo-mapping of facilities vs population size, access, etc.) as a follow-up to Supply Chain System Design work

title.narrative: UNICEF : Data
At least 25% of the PHUs submit vaccine and device stock balance data using Rapidpro technology

target.value: Support the roll out of Rapidpro technology innovation for collection of monthly vaccine stock data at PHUs for increased vaccine visibility, especially on vaccine wastage and utilization.

title.narrative: 1. Two quarterly physical stock takes conducted by end of November 2021 at national and district levels. 2. At least 80% districts reporting monthly on SMT ensuring visibility for vaccine managment and informed decisions

target.value: Support Data for management and decision 1. Continue to support effective use of Stock Management Tool and other vaccine management tools for improved vaccine management practices. 2. Support monitoring of vaccine stock by quarterly physical stock take at national level. 3. Support decentralized use of SMT to the districts including IRP. 4. Support to ensure quarterly cold chain inventory update from all districts. 5. Explore feasibility of integrating cold chain equipment into computerised maintenance management system (CMMS) currently under pilot testing) 6. To have summarized CCE data on a quarterly basis by districts

title.narrative: WHO : Human Resources for Health
Technical support provided for the training of 100 EPI stafff at national and district levels on immunization data management and quality improvement.
CDC Foundation : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity

Intervention results available and shared with stakeholders to document (i) feasibility (ii) effectiveness in terms of EPI outcomes for reducing dropout (iii) demonstration of skills transfer and capacity strengthening among EPI staff

target.value: Building in-country capacity among EPI staff on how to undertake an integrated model for defaulter-tracking using existing community health workers linked with PHU-level EPI staff during community outreach / demand promotion sessions in two priority districts identified by the EPI programme. In addition, support skills transfer in capturing high quality data needed to demonstrate effectiveness of the integrated-model on identification of defaulters and reduction of drop-out (Penta1-Penta3; MCV1-MCV2;).

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement
Cold chain optimization recommendation report available

target.value: In-depth analysis on cold chain optimization options for improved supply chain management (geo-mapping of facilities vs population size, access, etc.) as a follow-up to Supply Chain System Design work

title.narrative: 1. Cold Chain technicas trained 2. Submission of monthly report documenting that Cold Chain Technicians performed routine tasks; 3. Monthly temperature review reports available;

target.value: Support Cold Chain and Logistics managment (1) Support EPI team in conducting routine preventive maintenance of the new cold store; 2) Build capacity of cold chain technicians at national level on cold room maintenance and repair; 3) Establish temperature monitoring system across the country through effective use of RTMD and Fridge Tags; 4) Support to strengthen preventive maintenance system of cold chain equipment; 5) Develop standardized guidelines on the procurement and decomissioning of cold chain equipment) 6) Support cold room operations

title.narrative: EVM self-assessment reports with improvement plans from 70% of the districts

target.value: Support EVM self assessment at all levels of the country immunization supply chain system including the national cold store, 14 district store and selected PHUs in all districts
Support EVM self assessment at all levels of the country immunization supply chain system including the national cold store, 14 district store and selected PHUs in all districts

title.narrative: Clinton Health Access Initiative : Vaccine-Specific Support
1. High quality HPV introduction take place, with appropriate coordination of all stakeholders' roles/responsibilities

target.value: Provide support on coordination and accountability of HPV introduction including support on: 1) HPV TWG and coordination on non immunisation platforms 2) planning for HPV SC requirements 3) progress review 4) Microplanning best practice and quality assurance 5) coordination with lower levels on responsibilities, 6) EPI efforts on training and IEC, 7) AEFI guidance, 8) monitoring practices 9) Development of rapid assessment tool post 1st and 2nd dose administration)

Provide support on coordination and accountability of HPV introduction including support on: 1) HPV TWG and coordination on non immunisation platforms 2) planning for HPV SC requirements 3) progress review 4) Microplanning best practice and quality assurance 5) coordination with lower levels on responsibilities, 6) EPI efforts on training and IEC, 7) AEFI guidance, 8) monitoring practices 9) Development of rapid assessment tool post 1st and 2nd dose administration)

title.narrative: 1. HPV introduction takes place, with appropriate coordination of all stakeholders' roles/responsibilities. A transition report enclosing information on work plan, tools development, microplanning, training, IEC communication and disbursement (if any), will be generated and handed over to EPI by Dec?21.

target.value: Provide support (up to 1st dose introduction) on coordination and accountability of HPV introduction including support on: 1) HPV TWG and coordination on non-immunisation platforms 2) planning for HPV SC requirements 3) progress review 4) Microplanning best practice and quality assurance 5) coordination with lower levels on responsibilities, 6) EPI efforts on training and IEC, 7) monitoring practices 8) rapid assessment post-implementation (first dose) 9) coordination on preparation and implementation of second dose

title.narrative: 1. High quality HPV introduction take place, with appropriate coordination of all stakeholders' roles/responsibilities

target.value: Provide support on coordination and accountability of HPV introduction including support on: 1) HPV TWG and coordination on non immunisation platforms 2) planning for HPV SC requirements 3) progress review 4) Microplanning best practice and quality assurance 5) coordination with lower levels on responsibilities, 6) EPI efforts on training and IEC, 7) AEFI guidance, 8) monitoring practices 9) Development of rapid assessment tool post 1st and 2nd dose administration)

title.narrative: WHO : Health Information Systems (Data)
At least 80% of visited facilities are making proper use of RED Monitoring Chart

target.value: Revise and print RED Monitoring chart and monitor its use
Revise and print RED Monitoring chart and monitor its use

title.narrative: UNICEF : Health Information Systems (Data)
Monthly submission of SMT reports from National level. Monthly submission of SMT reports from at least 75% districts

target.value: Support Data for management and decision (1) Support vaccine supply planning and strengthening of regular SMT update and use, 2) Support monitoring of vaccine stock by quarterly physical stock take at national level. 3) Support decentralized use of SMT to the districts including IRP. 4) support to ensure quarterly cold chain inventory update from all districts.

Support Data for management and decision (1) Support vaccine supply planning and strengthening of regular SMT update and use, 2) Support monitoring of vaccine stock by quarterly physical stock take at national level. 3) Support decentralized use of SMT to the districts including IRP. 4) support to ensure quarterly cold chain inventory update from all districts.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
1. At least 50 newly procured SSDs are properly installed in selected facilities 2. Quarterly cold chain reports received on time from at least 8/16 districts

target.value: Support cold chain and logistics management: 1. Support EPI team in conducting routine preventive maintenance of the new cold stores 2. Support the installation of new CCE and provide routine preventive maintenanceof CCEOPs and the cold rooms 3. Continue to support temperature monitoring system across the country through effective use of RTMDs and fridge tags

title.narrative: ToR for the consultancy developed and finalised

target.value: Support cold chain assessment to inform cMYP development

title.narrative: ToR for the consultancy developed and finalised. Customized assessment tool developed.

target.value: Support the conduct of external Effective Vaccine Management Assessment at all levels of the country immunization supply chain system with costed improvement plans.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM
